properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 5:03PM EST until February 7 at 1:53PM EST by NWS Jackson KY
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Kentucky...

The Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Pikeville

The Flood Warning continues for
The Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Pikeville.
* until Friday afternoon.
* at 4:00 PM Thursday the stage was 32.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 35.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening and
continue to rise to near 37.6 feet after midnight tonight. The river
will fall below flood stage tomorrow morning.
* At 38.0 feet...Lower flood gate of Pikeville is deployed. Coal Run
Village Park is inundated. Red Creek Road is flooded and Mobile
Home Park is threatened.
properties.instruction:
Continue to monitor NOAA weather radio or your favorite local media
outlet for additional information. If you are in areas affected by
this forecast take necessary precautions.

The next update will be issued by 11 pm tonight.

A Flood Warning means that flooding is occurring or is imminent.
